newsitem.title: USA: Town & Country to refinance debt.
newsitem.headline: Town & Country to refinance debt.

text.p: Town & Country Corp said on Tuesday it has reached an agreement in principle with a group of lenders to refinance its 11 1/2 percent senior secured notes due on Sept. 15, 1997.
The agreement, which is currently being documented, provides for the extension of the maturity of the debt to the first half of 1998, the company said.
William Schawbel, chief executive, said in a statement that these modifications should provide the company sufficient working capital financing to fully fund its holiday season.
Town & Country is an international manufacturer of fine jewelry.
